snippet: The founder of Community First Services in Brooklyn has left a trail of exaggerated claims and self-dealing.
abstract: Community First Services, non-profit group awarded a $29 million dollar federal contract to operate a major halfway house in Brooklyn, won contract based on credentials and claims that have turned out to be exaggerated or false; situation illustrates considerable difficulties faced by federal and state governments in regulating halfway houses, even as they are entrusted with increasing numbers of released prison inmates.
lead_paragraph: The founder of Community First Services in Brooklyn has left a trail of exaggerated claims and self-dealing.

headline.seo: At Federal Halfway House in Brooklyn, a Dubious Operator
headline.main: A Halfway House Built on Exaggerated Claims
headline.print_headline: A Halfway House Built on Exaggerated Claims
